s2.title: What is it?
s2.p: Xalan is an XSLT processor for transforming XML documents into HTML, text, or other XML document types. It implements the W3C Recommendations for XSL Transformations (XSLT) and the XML Path Language (XPath). It can be used from the command line, in an applet or a servlet, or as a module in other program.

s2.title: How about this release?
s2.p: &xslt4j-current; is a beta Developer's release of &xslt4j2;. Since &xslt4j; 2.0.D01, TrAX has been revised and integrated with the XMP Parser API in the Java API for XML Processing, so &xslt4j; has been revised accordingly. s2.p: You need the Java Development Kit or Java Runtime 1.1.8, 1.2.2, or 1.3, which you can obtain from ibm.com/java/jdk/ or java.sun.com.
